text: RUBEN BRANDT (45) is alone in the railcar, sitting by the window, reading a book. The monotonous clatter of the tra is lulling him to sleep. He gets up and heads to the toil through the empty hallway. The train goes into a tunnel. hallway is dark. He goes in to the bathroom. He washes hi hands while whistling. Suddenly, a little boy appears in the background. The boy wears breeches and a shirt, stands in the bathtub and sta Ruben in the face. Ruben wakes up in the railcar. Another boy (FRANK DUVENEC WHISTLING BOY, 8), holding a snail, is sitting in front o him, stares straight into his eyes while whistling. A window abruptly falls open and a strong gust of wind sl Ruben in the face. Ruben is horrified; a little girl (VELAZQUEZ'S INFANTA MARGARITA, 7), is hanging outside th railcar.
Hey! Her fingers can barely grasp the metal frame of the open window. She screams for help.

(shouts ) Help me! Help me! The moment Ruben leaps over and catches the girl by her t wrist she bites hard on Ruben's bare hand. Ruben screams with pain, trying to pull his hand out of t girl's mouth, but the girl is much stronger and she slowl pulls him out of the train. Ruben is struggling to no avail. He desperately turns his head towards the boy, seeking help. The boy watches indifferently and keeps whistling his tune. Only Ruben's feet remain in the railcar; but to his horro he notices the approaching lights of a locomotive on the opposite track. Ruben screams. 0020. INT./EXT. - RUBEN BRANDT’S ROOM. POLYART CLINIC.

Ruben is breathing heavily as he wakes up on the couch u down, one foot stuck in the headboard. The wall above the holds framed honorary diplomas from renowned psychiatric conferences. He picks up a voice recorder.

My nightmares are getting stronger and stronger. Characters from famous paintings continue to attack me. This time, it was Velazquez’s Infanta Margarita and Frank Duveneck’s Whistling Boy. I haven't had a good night’s sleep in three weeks now. (takes a deep breath) Meanwhile, in the hall of the Polyart Clinic, the NIGHT G (38) watches the news.

«+. 20 degrees and highs near 27. Mostly sunny and dry for the weekend. Lowest relative humidity, 25 percent. BREAKING NEWS I. Breaking News! Approximately 30 minutes ago Paris Police announced that the priceless fan owned by Egyptian pharaoh Cleopatra was stolen from the Louvre Museum. Witnesses reported that a young woman in black broke the glass case containing the fan and then escaped by doing a back flip out of the window and speeding off in a red Mercedes in the direction of the Place de la Concorde.

location: STREETS AND HOUSES OF PARIS. FRANCE -

text: Two cars are chasing each other through the streets of Pa Behind the wheel of the first car is MIMI (28), the secon driven by MIKE KOWALSKI (40). Their cars drive in paralle close to each other. After taking a sharp turn, their car slightly bump into each other.
Bonjour, Madame!
Mademoiselle!
Well, Mademoiselle... you didn’t come to Paris to steal that fan, did you?

Non, détective Kowalski. I just wanted to give you something to do. Mimi puts the car into gear and rushes away. Kowalski dri after her. The car chase continues. Their way is littered with damaged cars, busted up shop windows, scattered tabl frightened tourists. The cars almost hit a CONSIERGE(65), who is feeding a cat
Cicicicicici! At a restaurant, a couple, GEORGE (60) AND MARGARET (55) having a romantic dinner.
Oh, Margaret, this city is just so romantic!
Oh, George!
I wish we could stay in Paris forever.
How about another bottle of wine?

(In French) Garcon, s’il vous plait! (Waiter, please!) Mimi and Kowalski crash into the restaurant, but the coup doesn’t pay attention. The cars continue to chase each ot They enter a narrow street, where Mimi pushes Kowalski’s on the wall. Kowalski is struggling to keep the car in th right direction.
(in a sarcastic tone) Impressive! A YOUNG MOTHER (25) is crossing the road with a crying ba
(to the baby in the carriage) Bidibidibidi! They almost hit the mother with the baby in the carriage. A YOUNG MAN (19) stands beside a small truck with his ph in hand.
Mom, I’m old enough, I can take care of myself... Mimi's car almost hits him but in the last moment he is pushed away.

location: STREETS AND HOUSES OF PARIS. FRANCE -

text: EVENING —- CONTINUOUS After a wild crash, they fall into a dance bar and contin their race on foot through the streets and rooftops of Pa Mimi nearly makes her escape with an elaborate somersault from one rooftop to another, but the chase continues unti they end up on a boat over the Seine, where Kowalski entr Mimi with an anchor rope. Mimi hangs upside down while Kowalski takes out a pair of handcuffs.
Mademoiselle... you were sent to steal the Regent Diamond!
Not bad for a Frenchman.
I'm not French.
(in French) Visiblement. (Obviously. )
Why the fan?
Because beauty shouldn’t be locked away. Mimi whips out Cleopatra’s fan.
Some beauties must be locked away.
Well, then choose wisely, mon chéri! She spreads the fan open and all of a sudden tosses it in the river.
No, no, no, no, no....! (beat) Don't! MIKE KOWALSKI (CONT’D) Damn! Kowalski jumps over the railing straight into the river t save the fan.

location: HOT AIR BALLOON. HIGH UP IN THE AIR. SLOVENI

text: Mimi is sitting in a hot air balloon. The idyllic landsca of the Slovenian countryside can be seen under her. She d a number.
A SECRETARY (35) at the Polyart Clinic answers the phone.
Polyart Clinic. May I help you?
Good afternoon, this is Mimi. Could I speak to Dr. Brandt?
Mimi who?
Just Mimi.
Ruben Brandt answers the call.
Hello? (beat) Yes?
I'll be straightforward, doctor. I have a problem that’s getting in the way of my work.
Narcolepsy? Tourette’s? ADHD?
Kleptomania.
Aha. So you're stealing from your employer.
Not quite.

Mimi stands in front of an advertisement poster for the Louvre museum - "THE FRENCH ROYAL TREASURY - THE REGENT DIAMOND" - it says. She smiles at the poster, like a cat would at the mouse i about to devour.
Mimi’s shadow follows her as she is climbing up the walls She enters the museum through a ventilation window. INT. - THE LOUVRE MUSEUM. PARIS. FRANCE - EVENING -—

Mimi runs through the Department of Egyptian Antiquities, when something catches her eye - the Cleopatra fan. Mimi hesitates. She looks at the “ROYAL DIAMOND EXHIBITIO sign and the Cleopatra fan one more time. She breaks the glass vitrine, takes the fan and jumps out of the window a moment before the last security bar falls down. She jumps into a parked convertible car and drives away. Kowalski follows her.
Mimi is in the air balloon, on the phone with Ruben.
So, hanging around wasn’t an option.
Are you sure?
(In French) Absolument. (Absolutely. )
Mimi packs her stuff in a hurry. Her phone rings. She fin it under the Psychology Journal with Ruben Brandt on the cover. She looks at her phone.
(annoyed) Oh, great. She answers the call, her voice turns sweet.
(to the phone) Hi, sweetie!
INT. — VINCENZO’S BOX CLUB. NEW YORK. THE UNITED STATES —
(angry) Cut the crap, huh! Where is my diamond?
Last time I checked, it was in the Louvre.
Well, the last time I checked I was paying you cash for it, huh?
Something came up.
A fan? (laughs ) Mimi, I would not want to be in your shoes right now. VINCENZO DELANGELLO (49) cuts the conversation.

location: HOT AIR BALLOON. HIGH UP IN THE AIR. SLOVENI

text: So, you see, I have to get better, and quick. I read in a magazine that you're the best shrink to treat artistic souls.
EXT. —- THE POLYART CLINIC. DORNBERK. SLOVENIA - DAY - SA
I don’t know about the best.
Well, it wasn’t a very good magazine.
Thanks for the vote of confidence. Mimi receives a text message from “Vincenzo:” I will find you! Mimi sighs. RUBEN BRANDT (CONT’D) Hello? You there?
Yeah, Doc. I’ll see you soon. She throws the phone out of the balloon.
Idyllic landscape with a lake and tall mountains in the background. Mimi is seen in a car, driving towards the Polyart Clinic.

A couple of people stand around a fire. Behind them, ther a folding screen with a romantic painted forest on it. Ru stands in front BYE-BYE JOE (30), MEMBRANO BRUNO (33) and FERNANDO (24). He begins an art therapy session.
-.. I don't wanna be Little Red Riding Hood!
Come on! It’s only a therapy. Yesterday I was Little Red Riding Hood.
Thank you Fernando! (turns to Bye-Bye Joe) Bye-Bye Joe, you are here because you can’t keep quiet in delicate situations. Playing this role is exactly what you need.
(sighs ) Okay Doc. I'll do it.

So, Bye-Bye Joe, you will be Little Red Riding Hood. Membrano Bruno, you will be the thunder, the wind and the wolf. Fernando, you will be the bells, Granny and Luke, the hunter. Okay, now you know your roles, so let’s start! We can hear Little Red Riding Hood walking through the forest: squish - squish - squish!
Aha... Squish - squish - squish!
Excellent. Places everyone - and let’s start! A dark and stormy night. A terrible wind roars. Ruben points at Membrano Bruno.  10.
Hoo0o00000... hoooo0co...
The bells of the nearby church ring... He points at Fernando.
Ding - dong!
Little Red Riding Hood is walking through the forest... It’s Bye-Bye Joe’s turn.
Squish - squish - squish - squish!
Somewhere in the distance, a wolf howls...
While in a cottage at the edge of the forest, Granny is asleep...
HYrrrrrrr..... haaaaa....
The same forest is also home to Luke, the hunter...
(yodels )
Thunder rumbles powerfully nearby...
(he vibrates noisily using his two-dimensional body as a membrane) Khhhhhhhhooooooco00! Ruben increases the tempo and brings the show to an audit climax.  11.

location: COLD WAR BAR. WASHINGTON D.C. THE UNITE

text: A taxi arrives at the Cold War Bar. KRIS BARUTANSKI (45) leaves the cab and walks towards the entrance. The door m MORTIMER(58) greets him.
Good evening, Mr. Barutanski!

Hi, Mortimer! The door opens and Kris Barutanski walks in, heading stra for the bar counter. He sits down next to his old acquaintance, JOHN COOPER (7 a retired CIA agent, who is watching the news. Right next him, a WAITER (30) is collecting glasses, standing next t the busy bar.

(to the bartender) Four Kalashnikovs! BREAKING NEWS II. «+. But Mike Kowalski, a private detective from Washington DC, managed to save the priceless fan by leaping into the River Seine, where the thief had thrown it. At the news conference, the Managing Director of the Louvre Museum, admitted that the incident revealed lapses in the security system.
I know that guy! Kowalski... Huh...
Is he one of yours?

Nah, his father, Gerhard, used to work for the Company. We worked on Subliminal Programming together, which focused on experiments with 16 mm film. That was one hell of a project. Good old fashioned rivalry with the Russians...

location: MIKE KOWALSKI'S APARTMENT. WASHINGTON DC. TH

text: HOCKEY (a hamster) merrily jogs around his wheel. The whe is linked by cogs and belts to a zoetrope, so that Hockey enjoy the screening of a film.  12. Kowalski watches the TV, muted. The TV shows scenes from action TV-series Larissa. At one point, Larissa performs acrobatic leap from a bridge onto a moving truck. He take sip from his whiskey.

Hey, wait a second! (Kowalski rewinds the footage) I knew it! That’s exactly the same forward jump with a backward somersault. (turns to Hockey) Hockey, I ran across an interesting girl. I have to get to know her. He grabs his laptop from the desk and looks up movie information on the internet. MIKE KOWALSKI (CONT’D) No way, can't be her... But there’s got to be... Bingo! Stunt double, Mimi. So, your name is Mimi. Are you a member of the Stuntmen's Association? (he types on the keyboard, then turns to Hockey) It's no good, Hockey. Mimi isn’t a joiner. The telephone rings. Kowalski gets up to answer it. He fi an oblique photo on the wall on his way. Next to the photo, a collection of knives from famous mov can be seen: First Blood, Knife in the Water etc. He answers the call. It's his mother, EVA KOWALSKI (70). MIKE KOWALSKI (CONT’D) Yes?
The same shirt again!
Mom!
Is it my fault? Did I raise you this way? International broadcast, same shirt as in November!
You have the memory of an elephant.
Don't humor me, young man!  13.
Hey mom, you want humor? Father's day is coming up. Care to tell me something? A mosquito starts buzzing around his head.
No. What are you getting at?
My father's identity?
Not again! We have already discussed this, I don't want to go...
We haven't discussed anything, you just keep silent! Who was he, Rasputin?
No. It’s not funny!
One suspect is out. 4 billion remain.
Mike, this issue is closed as far as I'm concerned. Sorry for pestering you, but... Kowalski stares at the data on the laptop screen. The mosquito is still buzzing around his head.
That’s okay, Mom.
Alright son. I will talk to you tomorrow. Take care!

Will do, mom. MIKE KOWALSKI (CONT’D) Eva Kowalski hangs up. Kowalski brushes aside the mosquit It lands on a glass pane above a collection of famous straight razors from movies. Kowalski swiftly, but delicately hits the mosquito. Only ice cube in his whiskey (shaped like Hitchcock's body) sh a little bit.  14.
It was his fault, Hockey. He drew first blood.

Ruben Brandt shows Mimi around the Polyart Clinic. They a walking outside in the garden, when they stop by Bye-Bye who is in the position of Rodin’s “The Thinker.” He doesn move, he looks like a statue.
Not a very good forgery. Bye-Bye Joe doesn’t stay in his position.
Hey - I'm not a forgery!
(flirting) What are you then, darling?

Different covers of magazines appear on the screen. All articles deal with Bye-Bye Joe, who, as a security guard, cannot keep his mouth shut. “Celebrity bodyguard Bye-Bye Joe apologizes over speech scandal!” “Celebrity bodyguard Bye-Bye Joe scandal monologue at Chi Fashion Couture Week” “BBJ: I need to shut up now!”
(flirting) I’m the real thing, baby. Ruben Brandt steps in the middle of the situation.
(scolding) Bye-Bye Joe!
I know, I know... Statues don't speak.  15. Bye-Bye Joe is back to the original position of The Think
(sarcastic) Impressive, doctor. Ruben doesn’t get the sarcastic tone. Membrano Bruno carv sculpture, Fernando plays a strange Indian instrument.
Art is the key to the troubles of the mind. RUBEN BRANDT (CONT’D) Membrano Bruno is two-dimensional, but he eats too much, which is getting in the way of his banking business.
Membrano Bruno tries to slip under a door, but he is too to fit.
Too many sausages!
EXT. - THE POLYART CLINIC. DORNBERK. SLOVENIA —- MORNING
Too many sausages... RUBEN BRANDT (CONT’D) He’s trying to carve his craving for food into stone to contain it.
“Possess your problems to conquer them.”
(surprised) Hm, exactly!
I read it in a magazine. Fernando walks towards Mimi and Ruben. He obsessively pla three-note melody.  16.
Fernando is dealing with his particular obsession by creating variations on a three-note melody.
What’s his obsession?
The signature he leaves after each successful security breach.

EXT. — PARK - NIGHT Fernando sits on a bench with a girl while he is typing o laptop. The electricity suddenly shuts down in a neighborhood, and three eyes appear on the facade of a ba The siren of an approaching police car gets stronger and stronger. Fernando shuts his laptop down in panic.
So, what about me, Doc? (imitates with her hand) Ventriloquism? Ruben shows Mimi to an easel with a blank canvas.
Your compulsion to steal comes from a deeper need. You are missing something in your life. (beat) I want you to paint it.
How can I paint it if I don't know what it is?
Trust in the brush. It will reveal all.

If you say so...  17. 0110. INT. - RUBEN BRANDT’S CABINET. THE POLYART CLINIC. DORNBERK. SLOVENIA —- DAY Ruben enters his cabinet with the mail and an Art Magazin his hands. He puts the magazine on the desk next to his v recorder, while he reads a letter. Suddenly, he hears a female voice from his desk. It’s EDOUARD MANET’S OLYMPIA (30).

Come closer, Ruben! OLYMPIA (CONT’D) Come closer! Ruben slowly approaches the magazine. Olympia’s face sudd jumps out from the cover of the Art Magazine. OLYMPIA (CONT’D) If I frightened you forgive me! And come to Paris to see me sometime. Ruben Brandt tries to pick up the voice recorder but he i too shocked. He throws the recorder to the floor and leav the cabinet. Meanwhile, Mimi stands behind the wall of the terrace and watches the whole scene.
The wheels of an airplane land on a runway.
Ruben Brandt enters the hall where the paintings of Edoua Manet are exhibited. Ruben slowly approaches Olympia. She looks him straight in the eye.

I’ve been waiting for you, Ruben! Olympia screams and suddenly swings her left leg, and her high-heeled slipper flies off. The heel of the shoe stick into Ruben's chest like a knife. The cat leaps at his fac sinking its claws into it. Ruben screams as he tries to remove the cat from his face. He falls on the floor and l consciousness.  18.

location: PRACTICE OF PROFESSOR WALDEN. WALDEN SOUL SP

text: Ruben is on a therapy session at PROFESSOR WALDEN’s (60) room. He watches the lake from the inside, lying on a recliner. His face is full of scratches, his arm is cover with purple and blue marks and bruises.
Ruben, you said that everything started after your father's funeral, a month ago. Ruben closes his eyes.
Ruben stands next to his father’s coffin with a PRIEST (5 and his father’s close relatives and friends. John Cooper among them too.

... Body to the ground... Earth to earth... Ashes to ashes and dust to dust... 0145. EXT./INT, - GERHARD BRANDT’S HOUSE. WASHINGTON DC. DAY -— CONTINUOUS Ruben leaves his car in front of his father’s house and w inside.

I went back to his house. I hadn't been to his lab in years. All my childhood memories suddenly hit me. When Ruben enters the film lab, he sees himself as a chil sitting by a film projector. YOUNG RUBEN (5) is with his father, GERHARD BRANDT (40).
Daddy, can I go outside and play with the snails?
No, Ruben. Maybe later. This time is our cartoon time.
(sobbing) But Daddy, please!  19.
Ruben, men don't cry! The past disappears. Ruben Brandt approaches the projecto and hits play.

location: PRACTICE OF PROFESSOR WALDEN. WALDEN SOUL SP

text: It was Rusalocka. My favorite cartoon.
Ah, the Little Mermaid.
But for some reason I couldn’t watch it. I felt anxious and I had to escape.
Remember the Sea Witch? Do you think she has any connection to your next visit, to Botticelli’s Venus?
I don’t want to talk about that.
(angry) Ruben, look at me! If you don’t let me help you, you’re going to kill yourself! Or someone else...

When I entered the room, she was already waiting for me... At first, the scene is almost idyllic. The painting comes life, Venus caresses Ruben with her hair, but suddenly, t scene turns into a nightmare as the hair turns into tenta of an octopus, dragging Ruben underwater, trying to drown devour him. He stabs the Octopus’ eyes with his finger. R barely makes his escape.
Mimi, Bye-Bye Joe, Fernando and Membrano Bruno enjoy dinn at a restaurant by the lake. Ruben’s recorder is on the table.
-.. and I bet Doc’s voice recorder belonged to Sigmund Freud! The guys laugh, Mimi just smiles.
Get serious, guys! Don't you want to help him?
But what can we do about it?
I feel like you already have a plan.
Yes. As a matter of fact, I do. And it involves all of you.
But there’s only one thing that we're any good at.
Exactly!
Doc is a tipo simpatico. But what's in it for us?
Don't you want to know if your therapy is working?
Let’s check it out! They clink their glasses.
Mimi, Fernando, Bye-Bye Joe and Membrano Bruno are on a b on the river Seine in Paris.
Guys... Cameras and alarm system are prepped.  21.
(high fiving each other) Great stuff, Fernando, I’m impressed! Bye-Bye Joe shakes a bronze spray bottle.
Don’t forget, Joe! Statues don’t speak.
(murmuring) Yeah, yeah... I got it. Statues don’t speak, thanks...
Bye-Bye Joe and Membrano Bruno stand in front of Musée d'Orsay. They move towards entrance "A."
And your mother is... normal?
What do you mean normal?
Well, I-I mean, is she three- dimensional? Bye-Bye Joe and Membrano Bruno approach the counter.

Yeah, she is three-dimensional. (to the cashier, forming a “v" with his fingers) Deux billets, s'il vous plait. (Two tickets, please.) The CASHIER (45) lifts her hand and forms a “V" with her fingers as well.
Deux? (Two? )
(again making a “V") Deux. (Two. )
Oui, Monsieur. (Okay, Sir.)  22.
Your French is really good. Is your mother French? Membrano Bruno looks at him.
Bye-Bye Joe enters the toilet, takes off his clothes and covers himself with bronze paint. A minute later Bye-Bye Joe freezes himself at the exhibit hall in the pose of Rodin's "The Thinker".
Visitors are walking in the hall. George and Margaret are among them. They look at Bye-Bye Joe.
Oh George, he doesn't really look like he’s thinking that hard.
Nah...
I reckon you look smarter than that.
I look smarter than that when I look in the mirror in the morning!
I mean he’s all muscle, no brains... So overrated, this statue.! Come on, let’s get the hell out of here! Bye-Bye Joe doesn’t move, but whispers.
(murmuring) Mmmm... All fat, no brains. Margaret turns back. For a second, she think she has hear something.
Membrano Bruno hides behind a painting. The SPEAKER (38) warns the visitors to leave the building, because the mus closes soon.  23.
Dear Visitors, in 10 minutes Musée d'Orsay will be closed. We hope you enjoyed your visit. Please be so kind as to go to the nearest exit.

(In French) Maintenant! (Right now!) The museum closes, the lights go off. Membrano comes out behind a painting and walks to Bye-Bye Joe. Bye-Bye Joe g off the pedestal as Membrano hands him the clothes. They towards Manet’s Olympia.
Listen man... I’ve been thinking. If your mother is three- dimensional, then what is your father like?
He is a one-dimensional guy.
What? He’s... a dot? They cut the painting out of the frame.
What are you talking about, Bye-Bye Joe? He isn’t a dot, he is a line! He is a tall guy. Bye-Bye Joe rolls up the canvas.
Whoa... I wouldn’t mind her in my dreams!

EXT. — MUSEE D'ORSAY. PARIS. FRANCE - EVENING Fernando and Mimi are in front of Musée d'Orsay. Fernando watches Membrano Bruno and Bye-Bye Joe through the securi cameras, while a painter paints a portrait of Mimi. Bye-Bye Joe and Membrano walk out of the museum with the canvas. Fernando leaves his light signature of 3 eyes on wall of the museum.  24.

location: COLD WAR BAR. WASHINGTON DC. THE UNITED STAT

text: John Cooper and Kris Barutanski watch the news in the Col War Bar. BREAKING NEWS III. Breaking News! Paris, Musée d'Orsay: the famous masterpiece Olympia by Edouard Manet has been stolen. French authorities are still unsure how the burglars entered the museum or how they disabled the security cameras. The museum has offered a 100 thousand euro reward for information leading to the apprehension of the robbers. Kris Barutanski takes his special trident-knife out from pocket and cuts a new cigar.
Huh...
A long time ago Gerhard told me that Napoleon III the moment he saw the painting, personally cut up Olympia with his sabre.
But I’m sure he took care not to harm the cat.. They both laugh. 0200. INT. - MIKE KOWALSKI’S APARTMENT. WASHINGTON DC. TH
Kowalski arrives home when his phone rings.
(into the phone) Ciao Mike!
Marina passes by practicing performers in Viareggio Circu
Ciao Marina! What do you have for me?  25.
Your mystery woman, Mimi... Kowalski is all ears.
She worked for three years at the Viareggio Circus in Roma. Acrobat, the best around. They kept her on even though she was a kleptomaniac.
(thinking) Kleptomaniac? That’s why she took the fan!
And she left a year ago.
To put her illness to better use.
I'm sending you a copy of her poster.
Thank you, Marina. Great job.
I know. You owe me some serious dinner.
And dessert.
Such a ladies’ man. She hangs up.

So that’s Mimi! Kowalski looks at the photo Marina sent him on the phone. zooms in the picture and recognizes Mimi's face. He takes long look at it, then strikes the screen of the phone, li he is caressing Mimi. He suddenly receives a text message from Christophe Boulv “We need your help to find the Olympia. Come to Paris ASA
Mike Kowalski talks to FRANCOIS (40), the museum’s head o security.  26.
And you went over last night’s security tapes, I presume?
Oui, the cameras were frozen.
Merci, Francois! I'd like to see the archive tapes one month back!
Kowalski fast-forwards through the tapes; visitors come a go. Suddenly, the recording shows a person jumping back a forth, waving his arms. Kowalski rewinds the video and ru it at normal speed.
Whoa, what’s he doing? Now we can clearly see a group of tourists. One of them scratches his own face. MIKE KOWALSKI (CONT’D) Oh, he is bleeding. Hm... performance art?

SEEN ON THE SCREEN: I fear that my auditory, visual and tactile hallucinations may be the early signs of acute schizophrenia. Ruben Brandt lays on a chair, typing on his laptop. His f is full of scratches, his arm is covered with purple and marks and bruises. Mimi, Membrano, Bye-Bye Joe and Fernando knock on Ruben’s door.
Not now! I’m busy! Mimi enters the room, the others stay at the door. RUBEN BRANDT (CONT’D) Not now!
Close your eyes, Doc! We’ve got a surprise for you. Ruben just stares at her.  27.
Mimi...
Please! Ruben takes a deep breath and closes his eyes.
Bye-Bye Joe, give me a hand!
Mimi and Bye-Bye Joe roll out the painting from the canva
Ruben opens his eyes. A drop of sweat begins to pour down face.
Wow, nice painting. He slowly gets up and walks toward the painting. The whol gang is inside. Everyone laughs with relief.
Ha-ha! See, Doc? Possess your problems to conquer them. 0230. NIGHTMARE - INT. - RUBEN BRANDT’S CABINET - EARLY
Ruben is reading a book when the doorbell rings. Ruben ge up and opens the door. A POSTMAN (40) is standing outside

(In German) Guten Morgen! Ein moment, bitte! (Good Morning! One moment, please!) The postman opens his mouth, and a huge sheet of identica postage stamps starts to emerge from his mouth. Ruben’s f is on the stamps.
Using these moist stamps, the postman wraps up Ruben's bo He uses a marker to write the address on his face.

Sh!  28. The postman lifts Ruben up and throws him over his should POSTMAN (CONT’D) (In German) Hoppla! Wir leben! (Hoppla, we're alive!) He skillfully throws Ruben into the mail van, shutting th doors behind him. The ride is wild, and Ruben's body flungs left and right. van finally stops, and reverses into place. The doors open, and two men in jumpsuits drag Ruben out, throwing him onto a treadmill and taking the suitcases on the plane.
A suitcase is thrown next to Ruben. Its label swings steadily, slowly hypnotizing him.

The next minute he dreams of climbing the steps of a huge temple. At the entrance, two stone Atlases hold an even bigger stone globe with the constellations drawn on them. Ruben is smaller than the their smallest toe, and needs t to pass by their huge feet and enter a marble hall. The stands are full, and Ruben is surprised that several hund thousand people sit there in complete silence, all watchi him. Suddenly, far away, he notices a raven-haired young man i red shirt. The young man stands with his feet apart with hands down, looking straight at Ruben as he approaches. R is confused, he doesn’t understand what’s going on. He ca make out a cowboy belt on the young man (Andy Warhol’s El I and II (25)), with a holstered gun. Ruben stops.
Oh, you are just in time, Ruben! Like thunder striking through the opening in the marble r the chanting of a hundred thousand people echoes.
Gun fight! Gun fight! Gun fight! Ruben is confused, his eyesight goes blurry, and it seems him as if the young man has just doubled.
What are you waiting for? Draw!  29.
Draw what? I don't have a gun.
